title: The Year for Canceling Debts and Caring for the Poor
summary: Deuteronomy 15 introduces the Sabbatical Year, when debts are to be canceled and slaves set free. It stresses generosity toward the poor and just treatment of servants, reflecting Godâ€™s mercy.

faq.question: What happens during the Sabbatical Year?
faq.answer: Debts are forgiven, and Hebrew slaves are released after six years of service.

faq.question: How should the poor be treated?
faq.answer: With open hands and generous hearts, without selfishness or hard-heartedness.
